hints.content:
$719 = 57 +{\goldE{?}}$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point 57 to point 719 is labeled, plus question mark.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/425db097f24988af611ecaef719c0aea129bdc75)

Let's start by adding hundreds to ${57}$ until we get as close to  ${719}$ as possible without going over ${719}$.

$\begin{align}
{57} +\purpleD{100}=157\\\\
{157} +\purpleD{100}= 257\\\\
{257} +\purpleD{100}= 357\\\\
{357} +\purpleD{100}= 457\\\\
{457} +\purpleD{100}= 557\\\\
{557} +\purpleD{100}= 657
\end{align}$

If we add $\purpleD{6 \text{ hundreds}}$, or $\purpleD{6 00}$, we reach $657$. We cannot add any more hundreds without going over ${719}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 57 to a new point 657 labeled, "plus 600"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/48326579527370fd594d97f961beb601e95cbef4)

Next, let's add tens to $657$ until we get as close to  ${719}$ as possible without going over ${719}$.

$\begin{align}
657 +\blueD{10}=667\\\\
{667} +\blueD{10}= 677\\\\
{677} +\blueD{10}= 687\\\\
{687} +\blueD{10}= 697\\\\
{697} +\blueD{10}= 707\\\\
{707} +\blueD{10}= 717
\end{align}$

If we add $\blueD{6 \text{ tens}}$, or $\blueD{60}$, we reach $717$. We cannot add any more tens without going over ${719}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 657 to a new point 717 labeled, "plus 60"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/984c0c0638e29e1464f5ddb7e815927a26959f2f)

Finally, how many ones should we add to  $717$ to get to  ${719}?$

$717 +\greenD{2}={719}$

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 717 to point 719 labeled, "plus 2"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4532fb31d4934b519e62ea0b3494f6c6db198ec9)

We added $\purpleD{6 \text{ hundreds}}$, $\blueD{6 \text{ tens}}$, and $\greenD{2\text{ ones}}$ to ${57}$ to get to ${719}$.

$\purpleD{6 00}+\blueD{6 0}+\greenD{2}=\goldE{662}$

![The number line with all of the arrows shown. The original arrow from point 57 to point 719 is labeled, "plus 662." The arrows spans the arrows labeled "plus 600," "plus 60," and "plus 2."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a51417161c8606d039f1855551a3bd67e33063f5)
